abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Technical Assistance Project in Yemen.
            The objective of the project was to improve staff capability
            in key departments of the Central Planning Organization
            (CPO) and to establish procedures that would strengthen
            CPO's operations and its working relationship with
            other ministries and agencies.  Bank's performance was
            satisfactory. Borrower's performance was satisfactory.
            The key lessons learned were as follows: (i) during project
            implementation, grants could become available and displace
            International Development Association (IDA) resource
            earmarked for specific project activities; (ii)
            institutional development components of Technical Assistance
            (TA) projects should be contingent upon government agreement
            on a detailed institutional plan for the ministry or agency
            concerned; (iii) in view of rapidly changing conditions and
            generally slow implementation, TA projects should be kept as
            small and focussed as possible to avoid long implementation
            periods; and (iv) agreement should be reached with the
            government that procurement and recruitment steps should be
            completed during the 9-12 months while effectiveness is pending.
